content: floof cowl and capelet floof is an ultra cozy non itchy neck wrap that is first knit straight and then in the round the split collar looks great over your coat and the cowl section can be worn under or outside your coat super fast knit makes an affordable practical and fluffy gift the faux fur yarn is extremely forgiving and produces a great product for beginning and experienced knitters alike three sizes so you can get the coverage you cowl like size cowl neck 24 body 32 total length front length point to collar split 8 big cowl neck 28 body 44 total length front length point to collar split 9 capelet neck 30 body 46 total length front length point to collar split 12 gauge with this yarn is very hard to measure and is not all that important for the end product gauge obtained for the cowl sample was about 2 5 st per inch don t worry about the row gauge needle sz 11 8 0 mm circular knitting needle - 24 60 cm stitch markers - 3 stitch markers are used one should be unique to designate beginning of round materials 90 140 190 yards super bulky faux fur yarn cowl sample was knit with knit picks fairy tail fur in topo big cow sample was knit in kfi collection furreal in gray big cowl capelet sample was knit with knit picks fairy tail fur in topo capelet abbreviations k = knit p = purl yo = yarn over pm = place marker sm = slip marker instructions using your preferred cast on cast on 40 54 66 stitches knit straight back and forth until piece measures 5 5 6 7 inches it does not matter if you end on a right or wrong side row 1 join in the round move the first stitch on the right needle over to the left needle place a distinctive marker on the right hand needle this is now the beginning of round bor knit two together you are knitting the last stitch and the first stitch together here k to end of round 2 k note on all knit row slip the markers 3 k 4 k 5 k 6 set-up row k18 25 31 place marker pm k4 pm k to end of round 38 53 65 stitches on needle 7 increase row k1 yo k to first marker slip marker sm k1 yo k to 1 stitch before marker yo k1 sm k to end of round yo note for the increase row you are doing a yarn over increase before and after the first stitch this will create a v in the front and you will be doing a yarn over increase after and before the center markers creating a sort of rounded back 8 k 9 increase row 10 k 11 increase row 12 k 13 increase row 14 k 15 increase row 16 k 17 increase row for cowl skip to row
